c74object.name: fl.spatial~
c74object.digest: Generates multiplication factors for a number of speakers from an input coordinate triple
c74object.description: The algorithm used is a modified version of DBAP, with extra features. Input may be in cartesian coordinates (x, y, z) or polar ones (azimuth, elevation, radius. Missing values at the input are assumed zero. Extra values are ignored. The output size is equal to the number of loudspeakers.

entry.name: /inputmode [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the input coordinate mode.
[0] - polar [1] - cartesian

entry.name: /speakers [variable length double array]
entry.description: Sets the speaker positions in polar triples (one triple per speaker).

entry.name: /weights [variable length double array]
entry.description: Sets the speaker weightings (one value per speaker).

entry.name: /maxspeakers [int]
entry.description:
Sets the maximum number of speakers to be used (the neaarest N speakers will be used only).
If zero all speakers are used.

entry.name: /points [double]
entry.description: Interpolate to point source panning (0 is modified DBAP - 1 is point source).

entry.name: /constrain [enum]
entry.description:
Sets the method for constraining positions outside of the speaker array.
[0] - none [1] - hemisphere [2] - sphere [3] - hull

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.spatial~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.spatial~. When set to 0 fl.spatial~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.spatial~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
